intro: Phrygilanthus mapirensis, commonly known as the Mapire sandveld daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, linear leaves and has a short, branched stem. Phrygilanthus mapirensis is often found in open grasslands and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
